snippet: Michael Forman, 72, whom a parole official once told he “could have made millions as a salesman,” was recently released from prison and is again accused of taking money under false pretenses.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column; Michael Forman, who has been in and out of prison since the 1960s, has a knack for persuading people into giving him money; after being out of jail for only one week, Forman is arrested again on charges of grand larceny after taking $5,100 under false pretenses from a friend named Sergei Khramtsov.
lead_paragraph: Michael Forman, 72, whom a parole official once told he “could have made millions as a salesman,” was recently released from prison and is again accused of taking money under false pretenses.

headline.main: A Long and Questionable Record in Sales
headline.print_headline: A Long Criminal History and a Stellar Record in Sales
